sentences.en: I buttoned up my coat; it was chilly.
sentences.cn: 我扣上了外套的扣子；天气很冷。

sentences.en: I was slightly afraid of their chilly distant politeness.
sentences.cn: 他们那种冷冰冰的、敬而远之的客套让我有点憷头。

sentences.en: If it is dry - cold in winter , it will be chilly in spring.
It turned chilly in the afternoon.
It was an unusual day for summer, damp and chilly.
sentences.cn: 这是夏季少有的一天, 又湿又凉.

sentences.en: It was too chilly for swimming.
It's a bit chilly and empty hereabouts.
It's chilly outside; be careful not to catch cold.
sentences.cn: 外面有点冷, 当心着凉.

sentences.en: It's coming in chilly; we had better go home.
sentences.cn: 天冷了, 咱们还是回家吧.

sentences.en: It's getting cold, and one feels chilly when the wind blows.
sentences.cn: 天冷了, 风吹在身上冷飕飕的.

sentences.en: On the chilly seas, Keats became feverish, continually coughing up blood.
sentences.cn: 在寒冷彻骨的海上，基茨开始发烧，不断地咯血。
房间慢慢变得阴冷起来。

words.tran_cn: 寒冷的；冷漠的；使人恐惧的；令人寒心的；呱呱叫的（等于chillin）
冷冻，冷藏；使寒心；使感到冷

trans.tran_en: chilly weather or places are cold enough to make you feel uncomfortable
